properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills continues or is expected. The coldest wind chill values will be between minus 50 and minus 60. Tuktoyaktuk and Sachs Harbour are experiencing these very cold wind chills this morning. These conditions will continue through the day or return tonight. Ulukhaktok can expect wind chill values between minus 55 and minus 60 tonight. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-06T09:25:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-05T17:26:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1825511028.2020
Area: Sachs Harbour, Ulukhaktok, Tuktoyaktuk - East Channel Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow, at times heavy, continues. Total snowfall amounts near 15 cm are expected by the time the snow comes to an end Friday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall expected. Total snowfall: near 15 cm. Locations: eastern Newfoundland, including Terra Nova and the Burin Peninsula. Timespan: Saturday afternoon and night. Remarks: The snow will be accompanied by moderate northeasterly winds which may cause reduced visibilities in blowing snow. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Further snowfall: 5 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northerly between 80 and 100 km/h. Locations: Cartwright to Black Tickle, and Postville - Makkovik. Time span: continuing until Friday morning. Remarks: Snow will combine with strong northerly winds to create reduced visibility at times in blowing snow. Conditions are expected to improve for all locations by Friday morning. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-06T13:59:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-06T02:45:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0689295722.2020
Area: Cartwright to Black Tickle, Postville - Makkovik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Further snowfall: 2 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northerly between 60 and 80 km/h. Locations: Rigolet and vicinity and Hopedale and vicinity. Time span: continuing until Friday morning for Hopedale and vicinity, and until this evening elsewhere. Remarks: Snow will taper to flurries tonight. Strong northerly winds will accompany the snow, reducing visibility in blowing snow. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-06T11:53:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-05T19:54:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0936123098.2020
Area: Rigolet and vicinity, Hopedale and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow and reduced visibilities due to blowing snow tonight and Saturday. Total snowfall: 5 cm, possibly reaching 10 cm Maximum wind gusts: 60 to 100 km/h Locations: Atlantic coastal regions of Nova Scotia Time span: tonight and Saturday. Remarks: A low pressure system will intensify near Cape Hatteras today and will track south of Nova Scotia on Saturday. Snow associated with this system is expected reach southwestern Nova Scotia tonight. At this time, the heaviest snow is expected to remain offshore. There is some uncertainty as to how far north the area of snow will spread. A slight deviation in the track of this low will have a significant impact on the snowfall. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-07T00:30:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-06T08:31:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2407329071.2020
Area: Lunenburg County, Queens County, Shelburne County, Yarmouth County, Halifax Metro and Halifax County West, Halifax County - east of Porters Lake, Guysborough County, Richmond County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: northeasterly 80 km/h, except 100 along parts of the coast. Locations: Atlantic coast of Nova Scotia. Time span: Beginning after midnight tonight along the South Shore, Saturday morning for Halifax Region, and Saturday afternoon for Eastern Shore. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-07T00:30:45-00:00
